summary: Email chain between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team and Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding discovery materials. The defense requests a hard drive be loaded with recent productions for Maxwell at MDC, as previous CDs were not working. The emails discuss logistics of delivering and loading the drive with the Seventeenth Production and upcoming non-testifying witness materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated defendant at MDC for whom discovery materials (the Seventeenth Production) are being prepared and delivered on a hard drive.

events.title: Discovery Drive Preparation for Maxwell
events.description: Email chain discusses loading a hard drive with the Seventeenth Production of discovery materials for Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC, to be sent via FedEx, as previous CDs were not working.

events.title: Seventeenth Production
events.description: Discovery production including subpoena returns, native carved images, and images, which is the material to be loaded onto the hard drive for Maxwell.

events.title: Reproduction of Seventeenth Production
events.description: A reproduction of the Seventeenth Production was made after the original disc was sent back, possibly due to issues with 8GB discs.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team and prosecutors are coordinating the delivery of discovery materials to her at MDC via a hard drive.
Previous discovery deliveries on CDs were not working, necessitating the switch to a hard drive.
The material to be loaded is the 'Seventeenth Production' from May 21, 2021, which includes subpoena returns and images.
The prosecution anticipates producing additional non-testifying witness materials (3500 material) by the end of the following week.
The email chain highlights the logistical challenges of providing discovery to an incarcerated defendant.
